context.p: In this topic you will learn how to configure oXygen to run on the currently opened XML file, applying a CSS file that has a similar name and located in the same folder.

For example, if you need to produce PDF from a file named test.html, this command line tool will automatically use the test.css for styling. The advantage is that the CSS does not need to be associated with a PI in the XML document, so you can use this setup for testing.

step.cmd: In oXygen, select the menu item Tools External Tools Configure..
Press the New button to add a new external tool
Enter into the Command Line field: cmd /c chemistry -in ${cf} -css ${cfd}/${cfne}.css -out ${cfd}/${cfne}.pdf -show-pdf
step.info: On Mac OS or Linux use: chemistry.sh -in ${cf} -css ${cfd}/${cfne}.css -out ${cfd}/${cfne}.pdf -show-pdf
